page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The area is mainly centred on Ludlow, a small,historic,market town on the banks of the rivers Teme and Corve in South Shropshire.It has a population of 7200 and is situated on the A49 trunk road midway between Shrewsbury and Hereford.The railway station serving Ludlow is on the Crewe-Cardiff line. Its main industries are trouser making and agricultural implements. Tourists come to see the historic buildings and Festival in the Castle. There is a livestock market every fortnight. To the west is part of Mortimer Forest and the rest of the area is mainly intensive cultivated grassland managed by large estates. The rocks of the area are mainly Silurian limestone and Old Red Sandstone.
